obsidian.fex¶

Modules¶

obsidian.fex.extractor¶

Module encapsulating feature extraction to produce machine learning input data

class obsidian.fex.extractor.FeatureExtractor(preparedData)¶

Bases: object

Feature extraction tool, for extracting and storing mean traces

Parameters:preparedData – dataset that has been processed for feature extraction
dump_save(ID, path=None)¶

Save extracted data to pickle file in obsidian/datadump or specified path

Parameters:
  • ID (str) – data batch label for later identification
  • path (str) – destination path (if not specified, default is obsidian/datadump)
mean_traces(rmax, nangles, centre=None)¶

Calculate mean trace vectors for all images in self.data

Parameters:
  • centre (tuple) – beam centre in pixel coordinates
  • rmax (int) – radius in pixels of data to be extracted, corresponding to the relevant resolution
  • nangles (int) – number of lines to average over: the higher the more representative the extracted profile data
Returns:

list of mean profile vectors extracted from image collection
obsidian.fex.extractor.get_params(header)¶

Return image parameters necessary for calculating a radius in pixels from a given resolution

Parameters:header (str) – filepath for header.txt file, containing all image parameters
Returns:wavelength, detector distance, pixel size
obsidian.fex.extractor.radius_from_res(max_res, header)¶

Calculate radius in pixels of a given maximum resolution. Use to compute rmax for Trace()

Parameters:
  • wl (float) – X-Ray wavelength in Angstrom (e-10 m)
  • max_res (float) – Maximum resolution at which user expects to find protein rings, in Angstrom
  • distance (float) – Detector distance in meters
  • pixel_size (float) – Pixel dimensions in meters
Returns:

Radius in pixels

obsidian.fex.trace¶

For extracting and handling intensity profiles.

class obsidian.fex.trace.Trace(image_shape, angles, centre=None, rmax=None)¶

Bases: object

Trace extraction and manipulation class.

Variables:
  • w (int) – image width in pixels
  • h (int) – image height in pixels
  • rmax (float) – maximum radius in pixels
  • lines (list) – array of line coordinates along which image values will be extracted

Instantiaing initialises array of line coordinates corresponding to angles, and sets instance variables width, height, rmax and lines.

Parameters:
  • image_shape (tuple) – image dimensions in pixels
  • angles (list) – collection of angles in range (-90, 90)deg
  • centre (tuple) – (row, col) pixel coordinates of beam centre. If not provided image assumed to be square and centred
  • rmax (int) – radius in pixels of data to be extracted, corresponding to maximum resolution of interest
display(img, traces, meanVals)¶

Display image with lines overlaid and resulting trace plots.

Parameters:
  • img – input image as numpy array
  • traces (list) – individual traces from each line
  • meanVals (list) – values averaged across all lines
Returns:

pyplot figure and axes objects
line(angle)¶

Calculate coordinates of a single line through image centre, with length 2 x rmax.

Parameters:angle – angle w.r.t. horizontal axis in range (-90, 90] deg
Returns:line coordinates
mean_trace(img)¶

Calculate the mean image profile across all angles.

Parameters:img – input image
Returns:individual traces and mean trace values
read_trace(line, img)¶

Extract image values along a single line.

Parameters:
  • line (np.array) – line coordinates as 2d np array
  • img – input image
Returns:

image values along line
